unit: Unit 4 | Probability, Random Variables, and Probability Distributions
title: Smart Musicians: What is the Probability?
question_text:
At a large high school, $31\%$ of students are involved in the school's music program (band, orchestra, choir, etc.). At this same school, $19\%$ of students are involved in the music program and are on the honor roll.
If a student is selected at random from among those who participate in the school's music program, what is the probability the selected student will be on the honor roll?
solution:
We are told that a student was selected from among those involved in the music program. This is a given condition.

We are looking for the probability of getting an honor roll student given the student participates in the music program. That is, we are looking for $p(\text{honor roll} | \text{music program})$.

We can calculate the conditional probability using the formula:

$$p\left(\text{honor roll} | \text{music program} \right) =\frac { p\left( \text{honor roll AND music program} \right) }{ p\left( \text{music program} \right) } =\frac { 0.19 }{ 0.31 } =0.61$$

Choice 'E' is the correct answer.

Explanation of Distractors

Choice 'A' is incorrect. We cannot simply subtract the given probabilities.

Choice 'B' is incorrect. This is $p(\text{honor roll AND music program})$.

Choice 'C' is incorrect. It represents $p(\text{music program})$.

Choice 'D' is incorrect. We cannot simply add the given probabilities.
